solution_line_template: The t-shirt costs ${tshirt_more_than_socks} more than the socks, so it costs ${socks_cost} + ${tshirt_more_than_socks} = ${tshirt_cost}.
The jeans are twice the price of the shirt, so they cost {multiplier_for_jeans} * ${tshirt_cost} = $<<{multiplier_for_jeans}*{tshirt_cost}={jeans_cost}>>{jeans_cost}.
